title: Root schema of a Transparency Information Language
description: This schema defines the Transparency Information Language

purposes.description: Newsletter will be sent out once a month.

BDSG-42-5 refers to the processing of personal data within...

nonDisclosure.consequences: If the data is not disclosed, the shipment cannot be delivered.

appropriateGuarantees.description: Here the appropriate guarantee was formulated by...

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Meta information for the identification and verification of the document.

_id.title: _id
_id.description: The ID follows the database-specific implementation and does not have to be set in advance; but should offer as much entropy as possible for globally unique identifiers.

created.title: Created
created.description: Creation date of the document as an ISO-8601 time code.

modified.title: Modified
modified.description: Last modified date of the document as an ISO-8601 time code.

version.title: Version
version.description: This number serves to version documents of a controller.

language.title: Language
language.description: All language abbreviation codes follow the established ISO 639-1 standard as identifiers for names of languages.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of an instance can be active or inactive depending on the policy's legal force.

_hash.title: _hash
_hash.description: The hash is based on one SHA256 calculation of the document.

controller.title: Controller
controller.description: The responsible controller is defined in here.

division.title: Division
division.description: Serves to differentiate between different areas of a company; particularly relevant for large companies.

country.title: Country
country.description: All country codes follow the established ones ISO 3166 country abbreviation standard.

representative.title: Representative
representative.description: The representative is a responsible real person that represents the controller.

email.title: Email
email.description: Email address of the controller's representative.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: Phone number of the controller's representative.

dataProtectionOfficer.title: DataProtectionOfficer
dataProtectionOfficer.description: The Data Protection Officer (DPO) of the controller.

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of the Data Protection Officer.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which the Data Protection officer is located at.

email.title: Email
email.description: The contact email address of the Data Protection Officer.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number of the Data Protection Officer (may include country prefix).

dataDisclosed.title: DataDisclosed
dataDisclosed.description: A detailed explanation about which data is disclosed in the processing tasks.

purposes.description: Newsletter will be sent out once a month.

legalBases.description: The data are processed on the basis of Art. 99 GDPR which states...
BDSG-42-5 refers to the processing of personal data within...

legitimateInterests.reasoning: There is an legitimate interest based on ... and is not overwritten because ...

purposeConditional: Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.

nonDisclosure.consequences: If the data is not disclosed, the shipment cannot be delivered.

purposes.description: Newsletter will be sent out once a month.

legalBases.description: The data are processed on the basis of Art. 99 GDPR which states...
BDSG-42-5 refers to the processing of personal data within...

legitimateInterests.reasoning: There is an legitimate interest based on ... and is not overwritten because ...

purposeConditional: Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.

nonDisclosure.consequences: If the data is not disclosed, the shipment cannot be delivered.

_id.title: _id
_id.description: The id of a data item that is disclosed. The id is necessary to distinguish several processing tasks of the same data item (locally unique ID that can be based on the database implementation).

category.title: Category
category.description: The data (category) the data disclosed is referred to.

purposes.title: Purposes
purposes.description: The purpose for which a data item is processed for.

examples.description: Newsletter will be sent out once a month.
Newsletter will be sent out once a month.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: In this schema the purpose is specified (i.e. a headline or purpose category).

description.title: Description
description.description: This schema refers to an exact description of the purpose the data is processed for.
examples: Newsletter will be sent out once a month.

legalBases.title: LegalBases
legalBases.description: An explanation about the legal bases for the processing of personal data disclosed.

examples.description: The data are processed on the basis of Art. 99 GDPR which states...
BDSG-42-5 refers to the processing of personal data within...

anyOf.title: AnyOf schema for the legal bases of the data disclosed.

examples.description: The data are processed on the basis of Art. 99 GDPR which states...

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: This field refers to the reference in legal regulations (laws, orders, declaration etc.). The format is set to uppercase letters for the legal text followed by hyphened numbers and lowercase letters for the exact location.

description.title: Description
description.description: An explanation about the legal basis used.
examples: The data are processed on the basis of Art. 99 GDPR which states...

legitimateInterests.title: LegitimateInterests
legitimateInterests.description: An explanation about the legitimate interests for the processing of data disclosed.

examples.reasoning: There is an legitimate interest based on ... and is not overwritten because ...
There is an legitimate interest based on ... and is not overwritten because ...

exists.title: Exists
exists.description: The legitimate interest only has to be stated if the processing is carried out in accordance with Art. 13 (1d). This field refers to the existence of such an interest.

reasoning.title: Reasoning
reasoning.description: If the legitimate interest has to be stated because the processing is carried out in accordance with Art. 13 (1d), it is described in here.
examples: There is an legitimate interest based on ... and is not overwritten because ...

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: An explanation about the recipients of the data disclosed.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the third party (recipient).

division.title: Division
division.description: The division of the third party (recipient) for structuring controllers into smaller entities.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address of the third party (recipient).

country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which the recipient is located at. Attention: This explictly specifies third country transfers!

representative.title: Representative
representative.description: The representative of the third party (recipient).

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the representative of the third party (recipient).

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the representative of the third party (recipient).

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number of the representative of the third party (recipient).

category.title: Category
category.description: The category of the the recipient.

category.title: Category
category.description: This category has to be given, even if the controller is not mentioned explicitly.

storage.title: Storage
storage.description: In this section, the duration of storage or storage criteria are given.

purposeConditional: Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.
Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.

temporal.title: Temporal
temporal.description: This schema serves to specify a temporal description of how long the data is stored and for what exactly.

examples.description: Creating backups.
Finishing ordering process.
Creating backups.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description why the data has to be stored..

ttl.title: Ttl
ttl.description: The TTL (Time-to-Live) specifies the lifetime of this data (category). It follows the ISO 8601 for time spans.

purposeConditional.title: PurposeConditional
purposeConditional.description: Specifies the purpose that requires data storage.
examples: Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.

anyOf.title: AnyOf schema
examples: Data is stored until the end of the ordering process.

legalBasisConditional.title: LegalBasisConditional
legalBasisConditional.description: If the storage is required by law, the respective one has to specified in here.

aggregationFunction.title: AggregationFunction
aggregationFunction.description: The aggregation function describes the calculation basis when specifying several time intervals. For example, if there is storage for 2 weeks for technical reasons (e.g. backup), but there is a legally longer retention period, the maximum aggregation function (max) would be selected (standard case). Aggregation functions available: min, max, sum, avg

nonDisclosure.title: NonDisclosure
nonDisclosure.description: This schema refers to the necessity and consequences of non-disclosure of personal data. According to Art. 13 (2e), this refers to the information whether the provision of the personal data is required by law or contract or is required for the conclusion of a contract, whether the data subject is obliged to provide the personal data and the possible consequences of not providing it.

examples.consequences: If the data is not disclosed, the shipment cannot be delivered.

legalRequirement.title: LegalRequirement
legalRequirement.description: Is there a legal requirement to collect these data?

contractualRegulation.title: ContractualRegulation
contractualRegulation.description: Is there a contractual regulation to collect these data?

obligationToProvide.title: ObligationToProvide
obligationToProvide.description: Is there an obligation for the data subject to provide these data?

consequences.title: Consequences
consequences.description: Description of the consequences in the case of non-disclosure.
examples: If the data is not disclosed, the shipment cannot be delivered.

thirdCountryTransfers.title: ThirdCountryTransfers
thirdCountryTransfers.description: This schema refers to the adequacy decisions of any third country transfers.

adequacyDecision.description: An adequacy decision was made on the 23rd April 2020 by...

country.title: Country
country.description: The country code of the third country.

examples.description: An adequacy decision was made on the 23rd April 2020 by...

available.description: Adequacy decision by the European commission exists?

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the adequacy decision by the European commission.
examples: An adequacy decision was made on the 23rd April 2020 by...

available.description: Do suitable guarantees according to Art. 45 exist?

presenceOfEnforceableRightsAndEffectiveR.description: Presence of enforceable rights and effective remedies

examples.description: These rights are given because of...

available.description: Presence of enforceable rights and effective remedies?

description.description: Description of enforceable rights and effective remedies.

standardDataProtectionClause.title: StandardDataProtectionClause
standardDataProtectionClause.description: Schema on Standard Data Protection clauses.

examples.description: The standard data protection clause which applies here can be found here: ...

available.title: Available
available.description: Does a standard data protection clause exist?

description.title: Description
description.description: An explanation about the standard data protection clause (may include link).
examples: The standard data protection clause which applies here can be found here: ...

accessAndDataPortability.title: AccessAndDataPortability
accessAndDataPortability.description: Defining the right to access and data portability.

examples.description: Data access is possible through...

available.title: Available
available.description: The information is subject to the requirements of Art. 20 (right to data portability) GDPR.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the requirements according to Art. 20 GDPR.
examples: In the event that the requirements of Art. 20 Para. 1 GDPR are met, you have the right to store your data in a structured, common ..

url.title: Url
url.description: URL to relevant resources such as access portals.

administrativeFee.title: AdministrativeFee
administrativeFee.description: The fee that refers to several copies.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of money to be paid for a copy.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency in which the amount of money for one copy has to be provided acc. to ISO 4217.

dataFormats.title: DataFormat
dataFormats.description: An explanation about the data format(s) the data is provided in.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: This duty to provide information is limited to the collection of personal data that does not take place from the data subject (Art. 14).
This information could be retrieved from...
This information could be retrieved from...

_id.title: _id
_id.description: This refers to an locally unique ID in an arbitrary but deterministic format.

dataCategory.title: DataCategory
dataCategory.description: The category the data refer to.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: Specify the source(s) where the data come from.

examples.description: This information could be retrieved from...
This information could be retrieved from...

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the source the data is taken from.
examples: This information could be retrieved from...

url.title: Url
url.description: URL (reference) where the data is taken from.

rightToInformation.title: RightToInformation
rightToInformation.description: Refers to the right of information.

examples.description: For the right to information please use this contact form and...

description.title: Description
examples: For the right to information please use this contact form and...

rightToRectificationOrDeletion.title: RightToRectificationOrDeletion
rightToRectificationOrDeletion.description: This schema refers to the right to rectification or deletion (Art. 16 GDPR).

examples.description: For the right to rectification please use this contact form and...

description.title: Description
examples: For the right to rectification please use this contact form and...

rightToDataPortability.title: RightToDataPortability
rightToDataPortability.description: The right to data portability as stated in Art. 20 GDPR.

examples.description: Data portability is only possible when...

description.title: Description
examples: Data portability is only possible when...

rightToWithdrawConsent.title: RightToWithdrawConsent
rightToWithdrawConsent.description: This schema refers to the right to withdraw consent.

examples: For the right to withdraw consent please use this contact form and...

rightToComplain.description: This schema refers to the right to complain.

examples: For the right to complain please use this contact form and...

supervisoryAuthority.title: SupervisoryAuthority
supervisoryAuthority.description: Defines the supervisory authority that has to be contacted in order to complain about the data controller's practices.

email.title: Email
email.description: Email adress of the supervisory authority.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: Phone number of the supervisory authority.

automatedDecisionMaking.title: AutomatedDecisionMaking
automatedDecisionMaking.description: Automated decision making and potentially involved logic. Does include profiling.

examples.logicInvolved: The personal data are processed as follows...

inUse.title: InUse
inUse.description: Is automated decision making in use?

logicInvolved.title: LogicInvolved
logicInvolved.description: An explanation about the logic involved to automated decision making.
examples: The personal data are processed as follows...

scopeAndIntendedEffects.title: ScopeAndIntendedEffects
scopeAndIntendedEffects.description: Scope and intended effects of such processing for the data subject.

examples.description: Due to technical requirements...
Due to technical requirements...

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the change of purpose.

affectedDataCategories.title: AffectedDataCategories
affectedDataCategories.description: Data categories that are affected from the change of purpose.

plannedDateOfChange.title: PlannedDateOfChange
plannedDateOfChange.description: Specify the planned date to the changes as ISO 8601 string.

urlOfNewVersion.title: UrlOfNewVersion
urlOfNewVersion.description: URL points to a document of the same as this one. That creates a chain of information requirements for seamless recognition of transparency information even over a longer period of time.
